articles.headline: Lobbyists Rush to Hire G.O.P. Staff Ahead of Vote
articles.snippet: With Democrats in danger of losing control of Congress, some lobbying shops, trade groups and contractors are moving to hire more Republicans.
articles.abstract: With Democrats in danger of losing control of Congress, some lobbying shops, trade groups and contractors are moving to hire more Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  With Democrats in danger of losing control of Congress, some prominent lobbying shops, trade groups and contractors are already moving to bring more Republicans on board to bolster their political fortunes.

articles.headline: Ron Bloom Is Obama’s Manufacturing Emissary
articles.snippet: The administration has pledged tax credits and subsidies to spur manufacturing but has said the lead must come from the private sector.
articles.abstract: The administration has pledged tax credits and subsidies to spur manufacturing but has said the lead must come from the private sector.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not since Ronald Reagan has an American president spoken so emphatically about the importance of manufacturing. “We’ve got to go back to making things,” Barack Obama says, embedding that view in his oratory. Yet manufacturing’s presence in the American economy continues to shrink, defying the administration’s attempts to reverse that trend.

articles.headline: Apple Gives App Developers Its Review Guidelines
articles.snippet: The company said it would relax its rules on how software developers can build applications for its iPhone and iPad.
articles.abstract: The company said it would relax its rules on how software developers can build applications for its iPhone and iPad.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple, which keeps a tight lid on its products and inner workings, is loosening up a little.

articles.headline: U.S. Urges Iraqis to Try New Plan to Share Power
articles.snippet: The United States is pushing a power-sharing arrangement in Iraq that could retain Nuri Kamal al-Maliki as prime minister but curb his authority.
articles.abstract: The United States is pushing a power-sharing arrangement in Iraq that could retain Nuri Kamal al-Maliki as prime minister but curb his authority.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is encouraging a major new power-sharing arrangement in Iraq that could retain Nuri Kamal al-Maliki as prime minister but in a coalition that would significantly curb his authority.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Anthony Shadid

articles.headline: A Rock Impresario Gambles on ‘Spider-Man’
articles.snippet: Michael Cohl, the lead producer of the musical, is taking a risk on the most expensive show in Broadway history.
articles.abstract: Michael Cohl, the lead producer of the musical, is taking a risk on the most expensive show in Broadway history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nearly a hundred feet above the stage of Broadway’s Foxwoods Theater, Michael Cohl wrapped his right hand around one of the cables that will soon fly actors over the audience at the musical “Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark.” For a moment Mr. Cohl, the accidental producer of the most expensive show in Broadway history, was on top of the theater world, and appropriately so: he is the money man who after years of delays has sent “Spider-Man” airborne. Thanks to him, theatergoers will get to see for themselves if it soars, or falls to earth.

articles.headline: Coverage of Koran Case Stirs Questions on Media Role
articles.snippet: Terry Jones put himself at the center of a controversy by using the news lull of summer and a 24-hour news cycle to promote his anti-Islam cause.
articles.abstract: Terry Jones put himself at the center of a controversy by using the news lull of summer and a 24-hour news cycle to promote his anti-Islam cause.
articles.lead_paragraph: A renegade pastor and his tiny flock set fire to a Koran on a street corner, and made sure to capture it on film. And they were ignored.

articles.headline: Top Adviser to Lead Panel on Economy
articles.snippet: President Obama will promote Austan D. Goolsbee to chairman of his Council of Economic Advisers.
articles.abstract: President Obama will promote Austan D. Goolsbee to chairman of his Council of Economic Advisers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Friday will promote a longtime economic adviser, Austan D. Goolsbee, to chairman of his Council of Economic Advisers, signaling continuity even as a high unemployment rate has left much of the public dissatisfied with administration policies.

articles.headline: Judge Rules That Military Policy Violates Rights of Gays
articles.snippet: While the policy, known as “don’t ask, don’t tell,” will not change right away, the ruling reflects others taking aim at discrimination against homosexuals.
articles.abstract: While the policy, known as “don’t ask, don’t tell,” will not change right away, the ruling reflects others taking aim at discrimination against homosexuals.
articles.lead_paragraph: The “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy toward gay members of the military is unconstitutional, a federal judge in California ruled Thursday.

articles.headline: Inquiry Sifting Cause of Blast in the Bay Area
articles.snippet: For weeks before the explosion, residents of San Bruno, Calif., reported catching a whiff of natural gas in the bay breezes.
articles.abstract: For weeks before the explosion, residents of San Bruno, Calif., reported catching a whiff of natural gas in the bay breezes.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN BRUNO, Calif.  For weeks, residents in this community of trim suburban homes in the hills near San Francisco International Airport had reported catching the occasional whiff of natural gas in the bay breezes. Utility repair crews were regularly seen driving around the neighborhood.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Malia Wollan
